generif.text: overexpression of stomatin-like protein 2 is associated with neoplasms
SLP-2 is a high abundance protein in several tissues and cells and may play an important biological role; this study uses mass spectrometry to analyze its primary structure
SLP-2 was overexpressed in endometrial adenocarcinoma compared with their normal counterparts.

High-level SLP-2 expression was associated with decreased overall survival (P = .011) and was more often found in patients with tumors larger than 20 mm, lymph node metastasis, advanced clinical stage, distant metastasis
Endosymbiotic origin of paraslipin from an alphaprotoebacterial ancestor (SLP-2)
SLP-2 is an important player in T cell activation by ensuring sustained TCR signaling
Familial MGUS and multiple myeloma were associated with a dominant inheritance of hyperphosphorylated paratarg-7
SLP-2 overexpression is associated with tumour distant metastasis and poor prognosis in pulmonary squamous cell carcinoma.
negatively modulates mitochondrial sodium-calcium exchange
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
plasma concentrations of stomatin (EPB72)-like 2 in early-stage colorectal cancer patients were elevated as compared with those of healthy individuals
The dominant inheritance of hyperphosphorylated paratarg-7 explains cases of familial IgM monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance and Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia
[review] Stomatin family member STOML2 is oligomeric; it localizes mostly to membrane domains and has been shown to modulate ion channel activity.
We propose that the function of SLP-2 is to recruit prohibitins to cardiolipin to form cardiolipin-enriched microdomains in which electron transport complexes are optimally assembled.
SLP-2 and HER2/neu can play a role in lymph node/distant metastases of breast cancers

investigation of biomarkers for early diagnosis of endometriosis: Data suggest that SLP2, tropomyosin 3, and tropomodulin 3 are autoantigens present in blood of women with endometriosis; immunodominant epitopes were identified.
SLP-2 facilitates the compartmentalization not only of mitochondrial membranes but also of the plasma membrane into functional microdomains.

SLP-2 deficiency in T-lymphocytes is associated with abnormal cardiolipin compartmentalization in mitochondrial membranes, defects associated with altered mitochondrial respiration that is increasingly uncoupled from ATP production.
Increased levels of SLP-2 correlate with lymph node metastasis in gastric cancer.
Expression of SLP-2 is associated with invasion of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.
SLP-2 may play an important role in human GBC tumorigenesis, and SLP-2 might serve as a novel prognostic marker in human GBC.
SLP-2 was upregulated by TGF-beta1, indicating a possible role of SLP-2 in Papillary thyroid cancer tumorigenesis.
STOML2 may have a role in progression of gastric adenocarcinoma
STOML2 was correlated to progression in cervical cancer, and implicated it as a potential predictive factor for the prognosis of cervical cancer.
Stomatin-like protein 2 is overexpressed in epithelial ovarian cancer and predicts poor patient survival

The significant association of SLP-2 overexpression with unfavorable clinicopathological characteristics and BRAFV600E mutation indicates that SLP-2 may have a role in aggressiveness of BRAF-mutated papillary thyroid carcinoma.
The expression of STOML2, a gene that plays a key role in mitochondrial function and T-cell activation, is associated with both IL-6 signaling and asthma risk.
results reveal an important role of SLP2 membrane scaffolds for the spatial organization of inner membrane proteases regulating mitochondrial dynamics, quality control, and cell survival.
Slp2 is involved in endometrial stromal cell proliferation and differentiation during decidualization in mice and humans
The downregulation of SLP-2 by siRNA inhibited cell proliferation, elevated caspase3 activity, and decreased CCBE1 expression

Data show that SLP-2 is upregulated by high cisplatin concentrations, leading to increased protein turnover. Overexpression of SLP-2 activates the MEK/ERK signaling pathway, and suppresses the mitochondrial apoptosis pathway, indicating that SLP-2 inhibits apoptosis by activating the MEK/ERK pathway and inhibiting the mitochondrial apoptosis pathway in cervical cancer cells.
SLP-2 promotes non-small cell lung cancer cell proliferation by enhancing survivin expression mediated through the TCF4/beta-catenin pathway.
TROP-2, SLP-2 and CD56 were effective diagnostic markers for PTC, especially when they were combined to use.

The knockdown of STOML2 significantly repressed the viability, migration, and invasion of LM3 cells. Authors observed that silencing STOML2 markedly downregulated the expression levels of MMP-2, MMP-9,MTA1, and nuclear factor kappa B (NF-kappaB), and upregulated levels of E-cadherin, tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases 2 (TIMP2), and the inhibitor of kappa B (IkappaB).
that SLP-2 may predict a poor prognosis in colorectal cancer patients as a novel marker

These findings demonstrated a positive feedback loop of SLP2 which leads to acceleration of tumor progression and poor survival of gastric cancer patients. This finding also provided evidence for the reason of SLP2 elevation.
Hyperphosphorylated paratarg-7 carrier state is a strong molecularly defined risk factor for the development of Waldenstrom's macroglobulinaemia.
Clinical significance of SLP-2 in epithelial ovarian cancer and its regulatory effect on the Notch signaling pathway.
Stomatin-like protein 2 (SLP2) regulates the proliferation and invasion of trophoblast cells by modulating mitochondrial functions.
Characterization of the interactome of c-Src within the mitochondrial matrix by proximity-dependent biotin identification.
STOML2 potentiates metastasis of hepatocellular carcinoma by promoting PINK1-mediated mitophagy and regulates sensitivity to lenvatinib.
Stomatinlike protein 2 induces metastasis by regulating the expression of a ratelimiting enzyme of the hexosamine biosynthetic pathway in pancreatic cancer.
Stomatin-Like Protein-2: A Potential Target to Treat Mitochondrial Cardiomyopathy.
CHCHD10 and SLP2 control the stability of the PHB complex: a key factor for motor neuron viability.
STOML2 restricts mitophagy and increases chemosensitivity in pancreatic cancer through stabilizing PARL-induced PINK1 degradation.

BP.term: proton motive force-driven mitochondrial ATP synthesis

name: stomatin like 2
summary: Enables GTPase binding activity and cardiolipin binding activity. Involved in several processes, including inorganic cation transmembrane transport; positive regulation of cardiolipin metabolic process; and positive regulation of mitochondrial DNA replication. Located in membrane raft; mitochondrial inner membrane; and mitochondrial intermembrane space. Is extrinsic component of plasma membrane. Colocalizes with several cellular components, including COP9 signalosome; T cell receptor complex; and immunological synapse. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
